security: Revealing that VAN HET REVE was granted a POA in June 1969 for use as an informant by SB/PO/M, W. Europe, under Project AEEGGHEAD, could compromise ongoing intelligence operations and endanger VAN HET REVE. Quoting directly: 'Subject was granted a POA in June 1969 for use as an informant by SB/PO/M, W. Europe, under Project AEEGGHEAD.'
summary: A memorandum regarding Karel van het Reve, founder of the Alexander Herzen Foundation, who is publishing writings of Soviet dissenters and was granted a POA for use as an informant by SB/PO/M, W. Europe, under Project AEEGGHEAD.
summary_one_paragraph: This memorandum, dated February 20, 1970, focuses on Karel van het Reve, the founder of the Alexander Herzen Foundation in Amsterdam, which publishes the works of Soviet dissenters such as Andrei Amalrik and Andrei Sakharov. The memo notes that van het Reve was granted a POA in June 1969 to act as an informant under Project AEEGGHEAD within SB/PO/M, Western Europe. Attached to the memo are clippings from the New York Times and Newsweek, detailing the activities of the Alexander Herzen Foundation in disseminating Soviet dissident literature.
title: VAN HET REVE, Karel - #839052
